intro: Beta perennis, commonly known as the garden hollyhock, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems and showy, velvety flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, pink, and white. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which also includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are typically arranged in clusters at the top of the stems. Beta perennis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
